name: Premier Inn London Beckton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 28 and 29 sept 2013. The ground floor room in the main building had been refurbished and was very very nice. Absolutely no moans and groans. The attaching pub next door did lovely food which was hot, tasty and value for money. Equally the breakfasts were excellent. The docklands light railway station is literally next door and a fabulous service direct into london. We bought an off peak day ticket for £8 (DLR and tube zones 1 to 4) which was good value for money. Asda is across the road with a petrol station. Not a lot around and about but if you want a good value for money base to see the sights in London, then this is the place. When all said and done a days sightseeing is gruelling and all you want is a soak in the bath and a good evening meal before crashing out. Beds are firm and the rooms have a portable fan on a stand which we used during the night and did the trick.
reviews.title: Brill

reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights at this hotel which is ideally situated if you are working at Excel for any reason. The attached pub is lacklustre and as there is little else around there I found myself having to eat there - don't bother.
reviews.title: Ideal for Excel but the pub attached to it lets it down.

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and tidy and you can get in via the pub if you don't want to walk all the way round after getting off the train but note they lock the pub door at 10.30pm. There is no a/c but there us heating if you are there in winter. The staff are friendly enough and as with all Premier Inns you pay up front.
reviews.title: Beckton hotel in London

reviews.text: Everything is clean and comfortable and if you want less noise from the car park I suggest you ask for a room upstairs.
reviews.title: Handy for the excel

reviews.text: Friendly staff lovely cosy hotel and rooms
reviews.title: Premier Inn Beckton/Premier Inn Generally

reviews.text: Pretty standard stuff for Premiers, clean, friendly and reasonably priced. Handy for the DLR almost next door. A bit noisy in the rooms on the road side if you need to have the window open. Not so handy for eating out
reviews.title: Premier Beckton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ........because the receptionist was friendly and very efficient; the room was large and spotlessly clean and there was a large carpark.
reviews.title: Would have liked to give four stars

reviews.text: The only problem was the fan did not work and it was a warm evening: we were in the block across the carpark from the main building and I could find no way of reaching reception other than via an 0870 number at 10p per minute. The phone in the room had a Fix It button but the number was out of order....
reviews.title: Couldnt fault it. Does exactly what it says on the tin

reviews.text: Can't comment on the food as we left very early, before breakfast was available.
reviews.title: Really good stay

reviews.text: On balance. a good place at a good price (and close to an Asda, which can be quite handy!).
reviews.title: Lone female traveller

reviews.text: We chose the becton because it looked convenient for getting to 02 for concert. The hotel is next door to the end of the DLR which allowed easy access to London attractions without being too close to central London. The hotel is joined to a pub with good food available. There is not much around the hotel and therefore is suitable to use as a base for attending London attractions.
reviews.title: Convenient for 02 concert.wew

reviews.text: we would definitely stay again for future trips to London.
reviews.title: Family Trip To London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here for a planned trip to London with our 2 teenage daughters. The free car park, DLR station right next door and an Asda literally across the road from the hotel made our stay very convenient. The staff were very friendly and I would recommend the breakfast as its is buffet style, all-you-can-eat with a great selection of fresh fruit, cereals and full English. A great start to a busy day.We would stay here again and would recommend to family and friends
reviews.title: London trip - Good experience at Premier

reviews.text: We travelled to Beckton on 24th August and despite the awful rain in the South East managed to find the Premier Inn. We had booked online for three nights at a a very good price. The staff were extremely welcoming and we had a double room not facing the road. As there was a wedding on the Brewers Fayre was very busy so the young lady on reception ordered a Chinese takeaway for us and gave us plates and cutlery. Lovely English breakfasts £8.25 each morning and the staff couldn't do enough for us.
reviews.title: A credit to the Premier Inn group!

reviews.text: This Premier Inn is marvellous for parking free of charge and with the DLR right next door is great for central London (£8 return day pass). If you forget anything ASDA is opposite so cannot go wrong. Could not really fault this Inn, the only downside was the room being quite warm and no air conditioning but we did have a pedestal fan which was necessary, I believe they are having air conditioning installed fairly soon. Ingrid was on reception as we were going on the Tuesday who was extremely helpful regarding booking.
reviews.title: Holiday in London

reviews.text: The usual quality of Premier Inn room - no issues, other than it could have been cleaner.. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. The hotel is just round the corner from Beckton DLR station which is very handy for getting up into town. Breakfast next door at Brewers Fayre was very good - an 'all you can eat' affair. Free parking was an attraction for us.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Every comfort that you would expect from Premier Inns. Welcomed on arrival and my room was changed from the satellite wing to the main building. ( Nearer to the Brewer's Fayre breakfast room.)
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation but not so Brewer's Fair

reviews.text: The room was spacious, clean, warm -the bed comfortable and I got a great night's sleep. Although I was on the Main Road side of the building I was not aware of any noise from the road.
reviews.title: BEWARE DISABLED PERSONS

reviews.text: I had travelled to London to appear as a contestant on a TV show and found the DLR & Jubillee Lines were excellent.
reviews.title: Expensive

reviews.text: I has a meal in the Brewer's Fayre ( attached to the Premier Inn) - this was very disappointing on the Saturday night. Even more disappointing on the Sunday night when I returned to find that the Bar and restaurant were closed by 9.00pm!! - Good job I had some crisps.
reviews.title: Convient for a London stay

aka: Premier Inn London Beckton Hotel London
description: Great location for visitors to London, close to the O2 Arena, Excel Centre & next to DLR Beckton with frequent trains to Central London (30-40mins). Free parking and free Wi-Fi in our Brewers Fayre pub restaurant serving great value pub favorites including our new ‘All you can Eat’ self service £7.99 Premier Breakfast plus our £5.99 Buffet Place Theme nights: Chinese Night (Monday), Curry Night (Tuesday & Thursday), Mexican Night (Wednesday), Chip Shop night (Friday) and Carvery 3 course for £11 (Sunday). We hope to see you soon – Jamie Southgate (General Manager).
